SENT.plain: In cells in a haemopericardium associated with a B-cell malignant lymphoma, immature herpes type virus particles were found by electron microscopy
Epstein-Barr virus associated nuclear antigen (EBNA) and virus capsid antigen (VCA) were also found, both in the tumor cells, in the bloody pericardial fluid and in cultivated cells
Serological studies revealed high anti-toxoplasma antibody levels both in the pericardial fluid and in serum
Both EB virus and toxoplasma infections are assumed to have played an important role on the pathogenesis of the present case
